perturbation.original_text: 4. ACCEPTANCE OF SERVICES Dragon Systems may reject the Services if they do not comply with the specification set out by Dragon \s\ JB. The Services are deemed to be accepted if MMI does not receive a notification within 60 days after delivery to Dragon Systems or its customers.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. ACCEPTANCE OF SERVICES Dragon Systems may reject the Services. The Services are deemed to be accepted if MMI does not receive a notification within 60 days after delivery to Dragon Systems or its customers.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'if they do not comply with the specification set out by Dragon \s\ JB', the agreement no longer clearly defines the conditions under which Dragon Systems can reject services. This creates ambiguity and contradiction because the rest of the agreement relies on the existence of specifications, but this section makes rejection criteria vague.

perturbation.original_text: 5. PAYMENT AND PRICING Dragon Systems will compensate MMI for all Services rendered in accordance with the rates specified in the Annex "Prices." Unless otherwise agreed, prices shall exclude transport, insurance, VAT and Import duties (outside EC countries) to Dragon Systems' designated delivery address. For all materials in stock, older than 90 days, MMI will charge Dragon Systems with an Inventory Carriage Charge of [**] of its value per month. MMI will invoice Dragon Systems based on actual shipments that have been performed. Payments will be due in US dollars within 30 days after delivery, or when agreed after delivery of installments or the receipt of invoice by Dragon Systems, which ever is later. MMI shall invoice Dragon Systems indicating the performed services in US$ with reference to this Agreement. Dragon Systems shall be entitled to deduct from or set off against any sums which Dragon Systems may be liable to pay to MMI any amounts owed by MMI, its affiliated entities, subsidiaries or successors in interest.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. PAYMENT AND PRICING Dragon Systems will compensate MMI for all Services rendered. Unless otherwise agreed, prices shall exclude transport, insurance, VAT and Import duties (outside EC countries) to Dragon Systems' designated delivery address. For all materials in stock, older than 90 days, MMI will charge Dragon Systems with an Inventory Carriage Charge of [**] of its value per month. MMI will invoice Dragon Systems based on actual shipments that have been performed. Payments will be due in US dollars within 30 days after delivery, or when agreed after delivery of installments or the receipt of invoice by Dragon Systems, which ever is later. MMI shall invoice Dragon Systems indicating the performed services in US$ with reference to this Agreement. Dragon Systems shall be entitled to deduct from or set off against any sums which Dragon Systems may be liable to pay to MMI any amounts owed by MMI, its affiliated entities, subsidiaries or successors in interest.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'in accordance with the rates specified in the Annex "Prices."', the pricing mechanism becomes undefined. While the section discusses payments, the crucial link to the actual price list is removed. This creates a contradiction because the agreement implies compensation but doesn't specify *how* compensation is determined, making enforcement impossible without that Annex.

perturbation.original_text: 6. WARRANTY MMI warrants providing the Services with due diligence and care in accordance with the specifications set by Dragon Systems. Should MMI not supply the Services as agreed or should the Services become defective within 6 months from their delivery to Dragon Systems, Dragon Systems may at its option require MMI to complete or re-perform the Services within a reasonable period of time, rescind the contract or refuse payment of the compensation in part or in total, notwithstanding any damage claims.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. WARRANTY MMI warrants providing the Services with due diligence and care. Should MMI not supply the Services as agreed or should the Services become defective within 6 months from their delivery to Dragon Systems, Dragon Systems may at its option require MMI to complete or re-perform the Services within a reasonable period of time, rescind the contract or refuse payment of the compensation in part or in total, notwithstanding any damage claims.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'in accordance with the specifications set by Dragon Systems', the definition of the warranty is weakened and contradicts other sections. While the agreement mentions specifications elsewhere (like in Section 4 originally), the warranty is no longer explicitly tied to those specifications. This creates a contradiction because MMI's obligation is now vaguely defined, making it unclear what 'due diligence and care' actually entail, and what specifications they should be fulfilling.
